sn35.136:1.1: “Mendicants, gods and humans like sights, they love them and enjoy them.
sn35.136:1.2: But when sights perish, fade away, and cease, gods and humans live in suffering.
sn35.136:1.8: ideas, they love them and enjoy them.
sn35.136:1.9: But when ideas perish, fade away, and cease, gods and humans live in suffering.
sn35.136:1.10: The Realized One has truly understood the origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape of sights, so he doesn’t like, love, or enjoy them.
sn35.136:1.11: When sights perish, fade away, and cease, the Realized One lives happily.
sn35.136:1.12: The Realized One has truly understood the origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape of sounds …

sn35.136:1.17: When ideas perish, fade away, and cease, the Realized One lives happily.”
sn35.136:1.18: That is what the Buddha said.
sn35.136:1.19: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
